abstract: Pres Obama visits New Orleans, marking 10th anniversary of Hurricane Katrina by praising intergovernmental partnerships that rebuilt region, while acknowledging progress yet to be made; presses political case for government policies that attack public crises with bold intervention and fiscal support, comparing recovery from 2008 financial crisis with disaster recovery.
lead_paragraph: Ten years after Hurricane Katrina devastated New Orleans, President Obama argued that his efforts had not only restored the city to its pre-storm state, but made it even better.

headline.main: Obama, in New Orleans, Praises Results of Federal Intervention
headline.print_headline: Praising Federal Action in Katrina’s Footprint

snippet: Ten years after Hurricane Katrina devastated New Orleans, President Obama argued that his efforts had not only restored the city to its pre-storm state, but made it even better.
